Load Init Sine
Take an LFO, bring its rate up to like 10hz, and assign it to the sine feedback +/- 25% or so.

milestone.title: Surge XT 2.0
milestone.description:
Next level Surge!

This milestone presents a solid book of work we have slated for the next major Surge XT release, after the initial one we have released in Jan 2022.

items.body:
Couple suggestions for the formula LFO in XT2. Feel free to add more. 

Rename `intphase` to `cycle` for clarity. 

Normalize output from 0...1 to -1...1, to require less `*2-1`ing in the formulas. We have a unipolar switch to easily get 0...1 back from a -1...1 output if needed, after all.

items.title: Fix a crash-on-jog when wavetables not available
items.body:
If running surge with no wavetalbes, you get one and only one wavetable (sine to saw) from memory so the system works. But the jog buttons still went looking. Specificall, actually, they didn't try and load anything but they did try and accessibily announce the name. So move that announce block into the success block.

Closes #7347

items.title: Osc work -  FX bypass via OSC #7309

milestone.title: Surge XT 1.3
milestone.description: We thought we'd have 1.2.1 perhaps but it didn't happen, and then PhilS came and started working on OSC, so we have it as a big feature to form a whole new release around it!

items.body:
Load formula.
Change something and apply.
Undo with the editor open. 

You get the previous formula back, working correctly. But the editor window has two copies of the code in it, with the second one not applied. Close the editor and reopen and you're fine, but press apply before that and you get an error obviously.

Likely related to #7310

items.body:
```
bscross — Today at 7:08 PM
OK so, I'm guessing the latest nightly has the group names we've discussed. Just downloaded and starting to use, but they're all wrong. They seem to be pulling from the previous effect, or some other effect in the chain, and not the group names associated with the UI elements.

As an example, I was running a reverb, and was getting a group name of cabs, but cabs was another effect I was using in the first insert slot. I decided to test by switching out the reverb for distortion, and when I did, the group names were coming up distortion and EQ.
Actually it looks better after closing and re-opening the interface.
baconpaul — Today at 7:37 PM
Oh I wonder if I mis indexed thanks will look
OK I can confirm that
It only works if you are in A1S1 and stay there
Will open an issue
Thank you!
```

since we don't build clap, my new more clever rules didnt work

So just do the old gross thing on win32

items.title: Wp2
Rework the Windows ZIP phase to have a portable zip
items.body:
Previously we had a pluginsonly zip. Now we produce two zips; A pluginsonly zip with the plugins only and a second portable zip which adds the resources in the appropriately positioned "SurgeXTData" directory next to the assets, with a brief README copied in.

Closes #7313

items.title: Update John Valentine patches
MONO/MONO FP Gated Porta Fix. Behaviour Change
items.body:
In Mono and Mono FP the portamento would work incorrectly on a held release with a partial slide. that is, set portamento to a long time, Press C, press G wait until you get to about E in the slide, release the G. The porta-slide-back would start from G.

This makes it start from E with the appropriate phasing and time.

It is a change in bheaviour but a correct behaviour so there is no bailout option right now.

Closes #7301

items.title: Clamp Max Porta time to 16 seconds
items.body:
Max porta time was 2 (aka "4 seconds") but was modulatable across the entire range up to about 128 seconds I think. That's the same as stuck. So add an internal clamp which means even in extreme off the end modulation, you cap out at 16 seconds.

Addresses case 2 of #7301

items.body:
Copy and Paste a scene now includes the following

1. Any scene -> global modulators (like SLFO1 to global volume)
2. The insert FX chain
3. Any modulations to the insert FX move from A to B on paste so the topology remains

Closes #7166

Closes #7293

items.body:
Bypass FX would be a useful thing to add. 
This would need an additional boolean address per FX slot.

It would also be useful to be able to clear an FX slot. 
My first thought was that sending /param/fx/*/1/type = 0 should clear it. This address has type "contextual" in the spec (and I've misplaced my Touchosc somehow lol) so I don't know, perhaps it already does this already? If so, let's just clarify that in the spec, and otherwise let's perhaps make it so?

items.body:
If you have the Formula editor open and do one of:

Load a formula preset
Switch to a different patch (which has a formula LFO in the same slot)
Undo/Redo the "Apply" formula action

items.title: Portamento is borked

labels.name: DSP
labels.description: Issues and feature requests related to sound generation in the synth

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: Item submitted using the Bug Report template

milestone.title: Currently Unscheduled
milestone.description: We put issues in this milestone if they are not currently scheduled in our book of work. This doesn't mean we won't do them - it just means we haven't put them in a plan yet.

items.body:
An exciting 3 part series!

Episode 1 -  "0 = unmodulatable"

Load Init Sine and make it mono
Assign a Macro to portamento at full strength
Turn the macro up almost to full
Play a few overlapping notes and notice that they aren't gliding
...but if we make the baseline porta value just slightly >0 they do glide! 

Pretty bonkered right? Stay tuned, it gets weirder!

Episode 2 - "if (value + mod) > max then bork!" 

Starting at the end of episode 1, turn the baseline porta value up to where the macro would bring it past max.

The glide is now gone again, and in its place is the following wonderful feature: 
The first note you play sounds the correct frequency, the next note sounds the same frequency again no matter what key you press, after that each keypress will sound the frequency of the previously pressed key. :)

 Episode 3 - "Was it always like this?"

Un-assign the macro now, and keep the porta value high 
Press and hold C
Then press and release any other note a few times in a row (holding the original C).
The porta *to* the second note initiates the first time, but after that it's gone. 
It'll skip to the second note immediately but still glides *back* to C. 

If the distance to the other note is big and the porta is slow, you can hear that the problem begins already if you release the second note while the glide is traveling there. It skips up instantly and starts gliding down.

items.title: Bonsai Preset Levels

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: Item submitted using the Bug Report template

milestone.title: Surge XT 1.3
milestone.description: We thought we'd have 1.2.1 perhaps but it didn't happen, and then PhilS came and started working on OSC, so we have it as a big feature to form a whole new release around it!

items.body:
```
In other news: @morgan and others - I got a report from a rack alpha tester that bonsai results in massive level cuts in some situations and I can confirm it. Just latch a modern and drop in a bonsai and you get like a 20db drop in signal right away. the input gain also doesn't seem to help. I'm curious if there's something amiss in the circuit or if the test case is an odd one. I get really big signal cuts with latches across the spectrum though across most of the presets.
EvilDragon — Today at 6:00 PM
could it be a wrongly initialized member?
morgan — Today at 6:03 PM
huh
only thing that comes to mind is the input level was very much not set correctly and i always turn it down all the way on the input
but i've been off doing other things (working on opengl burnt me out and i haven't done any audio dev in months) so i have no clue what might be the cause in the code
baconpaul — Today at 6:05 PM
no the vst does the same thing as the rack module
EvilDragon — Today at 6:05 PM
maybe the input gain range needs to be recalibrated then?
morgan — Today at 6:05 PM
yeah it should
baconpaul — Today at 6:05 PM
right.
so i kinda think we need to fix it to ship though right?
like play a c chord, turn it on, you get a big drop?
or do others not see that?
EvilDragon — Today at 6:06 PM
yeah obv it's a blocker
morgan — Today at 6:06 PM
if it's suuuper clipped it'll be quiter
baconpaul — Today at 6:06 PM
(it sounds good if you crank the output level)
morgan — Today at 6:06 PM
i turn the input down 24 and output up 24
baconpaul — Today at 6:07 PM
you mean in code or on the UI?
morgan — Today at 6:07 PM
ui
baconpaul — Today at 6:07 PM
right so it sounds like a gain callibration then?
morgan — Today at 6:07 PM
i think there;s already a gain in and out scale, so changing those would fix that
baconpaul — Today at 6:07 PM
ok i'll open an issue
```

items.title: OSC doesn't automatically start up in DAW

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: Item submitted using the Bug Report template

labels.name: OSC
labels.description: Issues related to Open Sound Control (OSC) API

milestone.title: Surge XT 1.3
milestone.description: We thought we'd have 1.2.1 perhaps but it didn't happen, and then PhilS came and started working on OSC, so we have it as a big feature to form a whole new release around it!

items.body:
The problem being that `tryOSCStartup()` is currently called from `prepareToPlay`, but it requires data from `DAWExtraState`, however we only get this data when `setStateInformation()` is called, which happens _after_ `prepareToPlay`.

Atomics, etc. @baconpaul.

items.body:
**Bug Description:**
Parsing [Files] section, line 98... Surge XT.clap not found. no results in file search repo, idk :/ 
"D:\Work\Coding\surge\scripts\installer_win\..\..\build\Release\surge_xt_products\Surge XT.clap" does not exist.
when trying to build from Inno Setup
either fix this and I'll send pull request, or add install location picker, here's probably how:
function GetInstallPath(Param: String): String;
begin
  Result := ExpandConstant('{app}');
end;

**Surge XT Version**
I haven't installed it yet.. this is about building the installer 11/6/2023
* Version:
* Plugin Type: [VST2, VST3, AU]
* Bitness: 64-bit

**Reproduction Steps:**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to 'Inno Setup'
2. Uncomment the 2 lines
3. Click on 'Build->Compile'
4. Scroll down to 'Compile Aborted'
5. See error

**Expected Behavior:**
Build into installer, check if code works


**Computer Information (please complete the following!):**
 - OS: [e.g. Windows 11]
 - Host: [Inno Setup, Couldn't get VSCode to compile either, no log]
 - Version: ["" or 0.0.0]

**Additional Information:**
maybe it's a path thing? but I don't have access to Surge XT.clap
maybe it's just not hosted on github??

items.title: If someone else becomes an mts source, cede and be a client

labels.name: Tuning

items.body:
Mts has a clear api to slam everyone out of being a source and becoming a source. Surge can use this!

If someone else uses it while surge is a source, you should detect that, cede, and become a client

items.title: CHange FX Processor Startup Path
items.body:
Change FX Processor startup path to use the new rack startup path extensions; namely don't scan patches and wavetables and dont create a documents directory if it doesn't exist

While there add a juce 7 version hint to the params to avoid

Closes #7278
a jassert

items.title: Add the FX Group name to the end of Accessible sliders
items.body:
so rather than getting "channel, mix, channel, mix" you get "channel - Left, Mix - Left, Channel - Right, Mix - Right" etc

The implementation of this is kinda gross, but that's part of the sturcture of the fx. Along the way add a single function go to param index to group index.

Closes #7238

milestone.title: Surge XT 1.3
milestone.description: We thought we'd have 1.2.1 perhaps but it didn't happen, and then PhilS came and started working on OSC, so we have it as a big feature to form a whole new release around it!

items.body: Making the group titles accessible would probably be the right move then. It would also help in other areas. The distortion effect, for instance. The thing that makes it less confusing is that the drive and feedback separates the pre-clip from the clip stage.

items.title: Osc work - refactoring/enhancement of 'all notes off' handling
items.body:
Refactored SurgeSynthesizer::allNotesOff() to SurgeSynthesizer::stopSound().
Extracted code from MIDI all notes off handler to SurgeSynthesizer::allNotesOff().
MIDI all notes off now calls SS::allNotesOff(), as does OSC '/allnotesoff'.
All former internal calls to SS:allNotesOff() now call SS:stopSound;
OSC '/allsoundoff' message now supported, calls same code as MIDI CC 120 (all sound off).

items.title: Is Surge FX portable on windows ?

milestone.title: Surge XT 1.3
milestone.description: We thought we'd have 1.2.1 perhaps but it didn't happen, and then PhilS came and started working on OSC, so we have it as a big feature to form a whole new release around it!

items.body:
Hi

I know how to make Surge synth portable, but it seems Surge FX doesnt use the same folders (surgextdata & surgeuserdata), which makes sense of course. So, at least for the clap version, it recreates its own "surge xt" folder in $documents.
Is there a way to make it portable as well ?

Thanks a million !!

* Version:

**Reproduction Steps:**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to '...'
2. Click on '...'
3. Scroll down to '...'
4. See error

**Expected Behavior:**
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.

**Screenshots:**
If applicable, add screenshots/GIF/videos to help explain your problem.

**Computer Information (please complete the following!):**
 - OS: [e.g. Windows 10]
 - Host: [e.g. Bitwig, Logic, Cubase, Reaper]

Add any other context about the problem here.

items.title: Osc work: added parameter querying and modulation mapping
items.body:
Individual parameters may now be queried, which causes their current value to be sent to OSC out.

Modulation mapping may now be accomplished via OSC.

items.body:
Hi all, 
I made a patch the default patch of Surge by mistake. 
Now I can't reset to the original Init Saw - I tried to look in finder for the original file but it seems it has been overwritten. 

How can I reset to the original Init patch (reset all default settings?) 
I can't see to find that option anywhere
Thanks

2. Use the right block size for the lipol on the global amplitude and send, which are post downsample

items.title: Modulator name api refactor
items.body: mid-stream refactoring of Modulator name api, moved out of SurgeGUIEditor.

items.title: Remove old comment about RPN messages sent by Logic, clean up the explanation
items.body: These RPN messages that Logic sends are for realtime MIDI tuning (also supported by Cubase). We can just say we don't support any other RPNs than 0 (pitch bend range) and 6 (MPE configuration).
